intro: Cyrtococcum deccanense, commonly known as the Deccan moss. It is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Ptilidiaceae. This plant is characterized by its small, thalloid structure and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. It thrives in humid climates and is often seen growing on rocks or decaying wood. Cyrtococcum deccanense plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms.
